intro: Larnastyra indica, commonly known as the Indian larnastyra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
